Plant Biomass Utilization Research Unit, Department of Botany, Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok, Thailand
Institute of Biochemistry, Faculty of Life Sciences, University of Balochistan Quetta, Pakistan

head.citation-title: Value-Added By-Products from Sugar Processing Industries
head.abstracts: © 2018 by John Wiley & Sons Ltd.The major by-products of sugar processing industries are bagasse, mud or filter cake, and molasses. The presence of all these complex contents in sugar industrial waste effluents are creating environmental pollution on one side and opportunity for valuable by-products isolation and re-use of the contaminating materials on the other. The effluent from sugar industries contains a variety of organic and inorganic contents, which can be utilized for different beneficial purposes as valuable by-products. For the production of medium to dense fiber boards, the bagasse from sugar industries is considered as the best choice, due to its fibrous nature and low density. The alcohol produced during the process of fermentation also contains small quantities of sugars and some acids such as butyric acid, acetic acid and propionic acid, esters and some other compounds which are part of sugar cane juice or molasses.

source.sourcetitle-abbrev: Food Processing By-Products and their Utilization

coredata.dc:description: The major by-products of sugar processing industries are bagasse, mud or filter cake, and molasses. The presence of all these complex contents in sugar industrial waste effluents are creating environmental pollution on one side and opportunity for valuable by-products isolation and re-use of the contaminating materials on the other. The effluent from sugar industries contains a variety of organic and inorganic contents, which can be utilized for different beneficial purposes as valuable by-products. For the production of medium to dense fiber boards, the bagasse from sugar industries is considered as the best choice, due to its fibrous nature and low density. The alcohol produced during the process of fermentation also contains small quantities of sugars and some acids such as butyric acid, acetic acid and propionic acid, esters and some other compounds which are part of sugar cane juice or molasses.
coredata.prism:publicationName: Food Processing By-Products and their Utilization
coredata.dc:title: Value-Added By-Products from Sugar Processing Industries
